pros: FCC really cares about their adjunct (as well as full time faculty and staff)! They provide training and regular professional development for full time and adjunct.
cons: None. FCC is a great place to work!

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Instructor continuing education  in Frederick, MD
pros: Flexible contract work, passionate staff
cons: Limited support for role as evening instructor

review_title: overworked for level of pay and no merit increases on COLA
pros: the work is rewarding and community oriented
cons: you can be the best at your job or the worst and everyone gets the same raises, just COLA. no merit increases and little room for internal growth.

pros: Some people trying to strongly impact people's lives
cons: Internal mess. Leadership transitions abounded

pros:
- 35 hr work week
- Hybrid Remote
- Numerous holidays
- Lots of Vacation/Sick Time
- Good colleagues
- Management doesn't micromanage
cons:
- Management can be directionless
- Creative projects can come from anyone on campus at anytime
- Tough to gauge average workload

job_title: Online ESL Instructor in Frederick, MD
pros: The students are eager to learn and you really feel like your work helps people improve their life/work conditions
cons:
The management is toxic. There are only a couple people making all decisions, which leads a lot of unsupervised mistakes. I had a major payment cut because of a mistake made by them last year, and it took me several weeks and phone calls to get it corrected. No apologies, no explanation given.

The email language is also very disrespectful, and with the limited communication, the teachers are treated as vendors, not educators. I am just so glad that I have no relation with this toxic environment any more.

job_title: Assistant Dean, Assessment and Articulation in Frederick, MD
pros: Colleagues, Benefits, Salary, Students, Mission
cons: Leadership, Supervision, Management, Upper Administration, Senior Leadership

pros: Continuous improvements are being made to increase DEI and structure the college in a way that encourages innovation
cons: Prior to this year there was leadership in place that impeded progress, some systems need work and it may be a multiple year process. Primarily I think they could improve the hiring process in a way that values internal candidates more. We also need to work on making education accessible to all, an ongoing process.

job_title: Facilities Planning Specialist in Frederick, MD
pros: great people, community, beautiful campus
cons: politics, people, drama, politics, politics

pros: The campus is nice, and most of the staff is cordial. The students are good too.
cons: Things could be more integrated. They could benefit from a more holistic approach.

job_title: Tech Connect Coordinator in Frederick, MD
pros: Well I have been home most of my time there due to covid.
cons: It has been a strange time to work on a grant during covid.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Great faculty and staff and a beautiful campus.
cons: Average compensation for an adjunct

review_title: Excellent Co-workers, new leadership is making positive change
pros: enjoy my colleagues and coworkers, very friendly place to work and everyone is there for the same reason, to make this the best place for students. Nice campus to work on, free gym access and walking trail and family friendly work environment, normal hours, good vacation and other benefits. Lots of new policies and changes with new president. Some do not like change, but all change is for the better to advance the school and workforce forward.
cons: not much room for pay increases based on merit (only cost of living type increases) which is hard when you have excellent staff you would like to advance (and keep!) and not always room for job growth

review_title: The individual departments are all run very differently, my department has pleasant leadership, others don't.
pros: friendly colleagues in most departments, leadership is new now so there is promise for change.
cons: adjuncts are not treated with respect. no benefits (not even tuition) at all for adjuncts which make up a large portion of the teaching faculty. HR is pathetic, truly. No consideration for internal candidates. Interview process for even admin jobs is ridiculous and often the department hiring you does not have the last word. There has been a "we have always done it that way" mindset that is present, but with new president, this may change.

pros: Majority of employees are wonderful to work with and truly care about the students, great full-time work schedule (standard is 35 hours per week), team-oriented environment, fantastic paid leave benefits (including a 2-week Winter Break), family-friendly workplace, beautiful campus facilities, comfortable working environment, family-like atmosphere in most areas of the college
cons: Office politics in some departments, disconnect/ lack of communication between upper leadership and lower-level employees, difficult for most employees to get promoted or have their positions reclassified when job duties expand, employees have not received significant raises in many years

pros: coworkers are friendly and most people truly care about the college mission and students.
cons: If you want to advance in your career stay clear of FCC. They are not about growing their own talent and do not promote for good work (you have to apply for a job and it is open to outside applicants too so they will always find someone better our there instead of trusting in and growing existing talent). It gets frustrating if you are someone who likes to grow and advance.

review_title: All employees are expendable regardless of how well they perform their job duties.
pros: You care about non-traditional students and the community college mission. You enjoy providing access to education for the ones who need education the most. You love winter break, spring break, state pensions, and wonderful health insurance benefits.
cons: Good ol' boy network and a toxic management environment. No work-life balance unless a life-or-death situation is announced. Employees are overworked. No upward evaluations! No performance reviews (in my department at least).

review_title: Work Experience at Frederick Community College
job_title: Computer Lab Aide in Frederick, MD
pros: The work environment can be pleasant and enjoyable. It  all depends on the manager that you are assigned. I had the pleasure to work under a wonderful and personable manager who knows how to treat his workers with respect and dignity.
cons: If you're someone who desires to take on more challenging responsibilities in the IT field, you probably should start looking for other opportunities

job_title: Nuclear Medicine Consultant in Olney, MD
pros: Relaxed academic environment in the Community College environment with multiple resouces available to further your communication capability.
cons: Must commit to a time-consuming preparation, teaching and academic evaluation process with a  low salary as compensation.  Your personal value system to enjoy the medical teaching environment must override any monetary goals.

review_title: overall nice place to work, but not the most forward work environment
pros: excellent benefits, annual and sick leave (not PTO, they still distinguish), nice coworkers.
cons: often overworked, can get stressful. technology is outdated (no laptops, won't let anyone on VPN to work, just old desktop computers.

pros: There seems to be good support within specific departments.
cons: Lack of administration support - decisions are made based on upper management assumptions without surveying or getting information from the end users or those being affected by decisions.

job_title: Academic Program Manager in Montgomery Village, MD
pros: The mission of the college is compassion driven and it comes through in the college approach.  Strong leadership in President Libby Burmaster.  Student focused academic processes.
cons: Unfortunately, the pay is not the best if you live anywhere outside of Frederick County, MD.

pros: Flexible, great people, gold mine in the heart of Frederick, easy parking, on-site cafeteria, walking paths.
cons: Unsupportive management, no funds, operate as an island.

job_title: Game Room Attendant in Frederick, MD
pros: You get to sit there, do homework, play pool, eat, use your phone, listen to music, play video games, oh and I can't forget; control/supervise the game room.
cons: Can be loud in there at times with a lot of people.
